When ‖𝜽(t)−𝜽fairPS‖2>δsubscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2𝛿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}>\delta∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_δ, we have

‖𝜽(t+1)−𝜽fairPS‖2⁢<2⁢ϵ1−ϵ⁢β~γ∥⁢𝜽(t)−𝜽fairPS∥2≤‖𝜽(t)−𝜽fairPS‖2.subscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡1subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2bra2italic-ϵ1italic-ϵ~𝛽𝛾superscript𝜽𝑡evaluated-atsubscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2subscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}% \|_{2}<\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\|\boldsymbol{% \theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}\leq\|% \boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}.∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < divide start_ARG 2 italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_ϵ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (40)

On the other hand, when ‖𝜽(t)−𝜽fairPS‖2≤δsubscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2𝛿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}\leq\delta∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_δ, we have

‖𝜽(t+1)−𝜽fairPS‖2≤2⁢ϵ1−ϵ⁢β~γ⁢δ≤δsubscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡1subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair22italic-ϵ1italic-ϵ~𝛽𝛾𝛿𝛿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t+1)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}% \|_{2}\leq\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\delta\leq\delta∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_ϵ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG italic_δ ≤ italic_δ (41)

Combining the two cases together, we know that for t≥(1−2⁢ϵ⁢β~γ⁢(1−ϵ))−1⁢log⁡(𝜽(0)−𝜽fairPSδ)𝑡superscript12italic-ϵ~𝛽𝛾1italic-ϵ1superscript𝜽0subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair𝛿t\geq\left(1-\frac{2\epsilon\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma(1-\epsilon)}\right)^{-1}\log% \left(\frac{\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(0)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf% {fair}}}{\delta}\right)italic_t ≥ ( 1 - divide start_ARG 2 italic_ϵ over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ ( 1 - italic_ϵ ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ( divide start_ARG bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ), we have

‖𝜽(t)−𝜽fairPS‖2≤(2⁢ϵ1−ϵ⁢β~γ)t⁢δ≤δ,subscriptnormsuperscript𝜽𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair2superscript2italic-ϵ1italic-ϵ~𝛽𝛾𝑡𝛿𝛿\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(t)}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_% {2}\leq\left(\frac{2\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\right)^{% t}\delta\leq\delta,∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ( divide start_ARG 2 italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_ϵ end_ARG divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_δ ≤ italic_δ , (42)

which completes the proof for part (iii).

The proof of this part referenced [5] Theorem 8. ∎

D.3 Proof of Theorem B.3

In this part, we provide the convergence of the class of fair-RERM algorithms in Algorithm 2.

Theorem B.3 (Fair RERM Convergence) Under conditions in Lemma 2.4, suppose ∃α>1,μ>0formulae-sequence𝛼1𝜇0\exists\alpha>1,\mu>0∃ italic_α > 1 , italic_μ > 0 such that ∫ℝmeμ⁢|x|α⁢Z⁢𝑑xsubscriptsuperscriptℝ𝑚superscript𝑒𝜇superscript𝑥𝛼𝑍differential-d𝑥\int_{\mathbb{R}^{m}}e^{\mu|x|^{\alpha}}Zdx∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_μ | italic_x | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Z italic_d italic_x is finite ∀Z∈△⁢(𝒵)for-all𝑍△𝒵\forall Z\in\triangle(\mathcal{Z})∀ italic_Z ∈ △ ( caligraphic_Z ).

For given a convergence radius δ∈(0,1)𝛿01\delta\in(0,1)italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ), take nt=O⁢(log⁡(t/p)(ϵ⁢(1+β~/γ)⁢δ)m)subscript𝑛𝑡𝑂𝑡𝑝superscriptitalic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾𝛿𝑚n_{t}=O\left(\frac{\log(t/p)}{(\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta)^{m}}\right)italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_O ( divide start_ARG roman_log ( italic_t / italic_p ) end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_δ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) samples at t𝑡titalic_t. If 2⁢ϵ⁢(1+β~/γ)<12italic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾12\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)<12 italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) < 1, then with probability 1−p1𝑝1-p1 - italic_p, the iterates of fair-RERM are within a radius δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ of the Fair-PS pair for t≥(1−2ϵ(1+β~/γ)O(log(1/δ))t\geq(1-2\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)O(\log(1/\delta))italic_t ≥ ( 1 - 2 italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_O ( roman_log ( 1 / italic_δ ) ).

Proof.

Given n𝑛nitalic_n samples from 𝒟𝒟\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D, denote 𝒟^nsuperscript^𝒟𝑛\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n}over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT the empirical distribution obtained from them. Denote

G^fairn(𝜽,𝒟):=G(T(𝜽;𝒟^n),\hat{G}^{n}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=G(\text{T}(% \boldsymbol{\theta};\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n}),over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) := italic_G ( T ( bold_italic_θ ; over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (43)

(recall Gfair⁢(𝜽,𝒟):=G⁢(T⁢(𝜽;𝒟);ℒfair)assignsubscript𝐺fair𝜽𝒟𝐺T𝜽𝒟subscriptℒfairG_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=G(\text{T}(\boldsymbol{% \theta};\mathcal{D});\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}})italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) := italic_G ( T ( bold_italic_θ ; caligraphic_D ) ; caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in Eqn (32)). And also denote the Fair-RERM mapping as

F^fair⁢(𝜽,𝒟):=(G^fairn⁢(𝜽,𝒟),T⁢(𝜽;𝒟))assignsubscript^𝐹fair𝜽𝒟subscriptsuperscript^𝐺𝑛fair𝜽𝒟T𝜽𝒟\hat{F}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}):=(\hat{G}^{n}_{% \textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),\text{T}(\boldsymbol{\theta};% \mathcal{D}))over^ start_ARG italic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) := ( over^ start_ARG italic_G end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) , T ( bold_italic_θ ; caligraphic_D ) ) (44)

By Theorem 2 of [42], since ∃α>1,μ>0formulae-sequence𝛼1𝜇0\exists\alpha>1,\mu>0∃ italic_α > 1 , italic_μ > 0 such that ∫ℝmeμ⁢|x|α⁢Z⁢𝑑xsubscriptsuperscriptℝ𝑚superscript𝑒𝜇superscript𝑥𝛼𝑍differential-d𝑥\int_{\mathbb{R}^{m}}e^{\mu|x|^{\alpha}}Zdx∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_μ | italic_x | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Z italic_d italic_x is finite ∀Z∈△⁢(𝒵)for-all𝑍△𝒵\forall Z\in\triangle(\mathcal{Z})∀ italic_Z ∈ △ ( caligraphic_Z ), then if nt=𝒪⁢(1ϵ⁢(1+β~/γ)m⁢log⁡(t/p))subscript𝑛𝑡𝒪1italic-ϵsuperscript1~𝛽𝛾𝑚𝑡𝑝n_{t}=\mathcal{O}\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)^{m}}\log(t/p)\right)italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_O ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_t / italic_p ) ), where m𝑚mitalic_m is the dimension of the sample, we have 𝒲1⁢(𝒟,𝒟^n)≥ϵ⁢(1+β~/γ)⁢δsubscript𝒲1𝒟superscript^𝒟𝑛italic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾𝛿\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\geq\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}% /\gamma)\deltacaligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_δ with probability at most 6⁢pπ2⁢t26𝑝superscript𝜋2superscript𝑡2\frac{6p}{\pi^{2}t^{2}}divide start_ARG 6 italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG.

Therefore,

ℙ(𝒲1(𝒟,𝒟^n)≤ϵ(1+β~/γ)δ),∀t)=1−∑t=1∞ℙ(𝒲1(𝒟,𝒟^nt)>ϵ(1+β~/γ)δ)≥1−∑t=1∞6⁢pπ2⁢t2=1−p\mathbb{P}\big{(}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\leq% \epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta\big{)},\forall t)=1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}% \mathbb{P}\big{(}\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n_{t}})>% \epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}/\gamma)\delta\big{)}\geq 1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}\frac{6% p}{\pi^{2}t^{2}}=1-pblackboard_P ( caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_δ ) , ∀ italic_t ) = 1 - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P ( caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_δ ) ≥ 1 - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 6 italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG = 1 - italic_p (45)

i.e., with probability at least 1−∑t=1∞1−p1superscriptsubscript𝑡11𝑝1-\sum_{t=1}^{\infty}1-p1 - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 - italic_p we have that for each time step t𝑡titalic_t, it holds that

𝒲1⁢(𝒟,𝒟^n)≤ϵ⁢(1+β~/γ)⁢δ.subscript𝒲1𝒟superscript^𝒟𝑛italic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾𝛿\mathcal{W}_{1}(\mathcal{D},\hat{\mathcal{D}}^{n})\leq\epsilon(1+\tilde{\beta}% /\gamma)\delta.caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_D end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_ϵ ( 1 + over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG / italic_γ ) italic_δ . (46)

Then if dpair⁢((𝜽,𝒟),(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))≥δsubscript𝑑pair𝜽𝒟subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfairsubscriptsuperscript𝒟PSfair𝛿d_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\big{)}\geq\deltaitalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ≥ italic_δ, and Eqn (46) holds, we have

where the third line uses triangle inequality, fourth line uses Lemma D.5, and fifth line uses Eqn (46). In other words, the above shows that if the current pair is more than δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ away from the Fair PS solution, then as long as Eqn (46) is true, the Fair RERM mapping is a contraction.

Similarly, if dpair((𝜽,𝒟,(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))<δd_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D},(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\big{)}<\deltaitalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) < italic_δ, and Eqn (46) holds, we can show that

dpair⁢(F^fair⁢(𝜽,𝒟),(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))≤(1+β~γ)⁢dpair⁢((𝜽,𝒟),(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))+ϵ⁢(1+β~γ⁢δ)≤2⁢ϵ⁢(1+β~γ)⁢δ<δ,subscript𝑑pairsubscript^𝐹fair𝜽𝒟subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfairsubscriptsuperscript𝒟PSfair1~𝛽𝛾subscript𝑑pair𝜽𝒟subscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfairsubscriptsuperscript𝒟PSfairitalic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾𝛿2italic-ϵ1~𝛽𝛾𝛿𝛿\displaystyle d_{\text{pair}}(\hat{F}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta},% \mathcal{D}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}))\leq\bigg{(}1+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\bigg{)}% d_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathcal{D}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\big{)}+% \epsilon\bigg{(}1+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\delta\bigg{)}\leq 2\epsilon% \bigg{(}1+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\bigg{)}\delta<\delta,italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ≤ ( 1 + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ) italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_θ , caligraphic_D ) , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) + italic_ϵ ( 1 + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG italic_δ ) ≤ 2 italic_ϵ ( 1 + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ) italic_δ < italic_δ , (48)

which means the pair will stay in the δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ radius ball once an iterate goes in the ball.

Then we move on to show when t≥(1−2ϵ(1+β~γ)log(dpair⁢((𝜽(1),𝒟(0)),(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))δ)t\geq\bigg{(}1-2\epsilon\bigg{(}1+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}{\gamma}\bigg{)}\log% \bigg{(}\frac{d_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(1)},\mathcal{D}^{(0% )}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D}^{\text{PS}}_{% \textsf{fair}})\big{)}}{\delta}\bigg{)}italic_t ≥ ( 1 - 2 italic_ϵ ( 1 + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) the fair RERM mapping hits the δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ radius ball centered at the Fair PS solution. Again, if Eqn (46) holds, then denote the initial pair as (𝜽(1),𝒟(0))superscript𝜽1superscript𝒟0(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(1)},\mathcal{D}^{(0)})( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then we can use similar arguments as above to show that

≤\displaystyle\leq≤ exp(−t(1−2ϵ(1+β~γ))dpair((𝜽(1),𝒟(0)),(𝜽fairPS,𝒟fairPS))\displaystyle~{}exp\bigg{(}-t\bigg{(}1-2\epsilon\bigg{(}1+\frac{\tilde{\beta}}% {\gamma}\bigg{)}\bigg{)}d_{\text{pair}}\big{(}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{(1)},% \mathcal{D}^{(0)}),(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}},\mathcal{D% }^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair}})\big{)}italic_e italic_x italic_p ( - italic_t ( 1 - 2 italic_ϵ ( 1 + divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_β end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ end_ARG ) ) italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT pair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , ( bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) )
≤\displaystyle\leq≤ δ.𝛿\displaystyle~{}\delta.italic_δ . (49)

This completes the proof.

For the k𝑘kitalic_k-Delayed RERM, we can follow the proof of part (ii) in Theorem 5.2 that the transition TksuperscriptT𝑘\text{T}^{k}T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is ϵ~:=ϵ1−ϵassign~italic-ϵitalic-ϵ1italic-ϵ\tilde{\epsilon}:=\frac{\epsilon}{1-\epsilon}over~ start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG := divide start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_ϵ end_ARG jointly sensitive, and if we replace the ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ terms with ϵ~~italic-ϵ\tilde{\epsilon}over~ start_ARG italic_ϵ end_ARG and times a k𝑘kitalic_k scalar in the number of iterations, we can get the similar result.

The proof of this part referenced Theorem 5 in [5] ∎

D.4 Proof of the Fairness Guarantee

Discussion of the intricate nature of proving the effectiveness of ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ under the general PP setting. We first note that it is non-trivial to find out whether fairness at PS solution increases as ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ increases under the general setting where both the group fractions and the group-wise feature-label distributions change. Consider an example where the agents in the minority group are influenced by the majority group, i.e., when their group fraction becomes less than a threshold, their tastes are shaped by the mainstream culture. Then they can change their feature-label distributions to be more similar to the one of the majority group. This will possibly make the loss disparity smaller even when ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ becomes larger. However, in majority of previous work on the retention of recommendation system [2, 12], the group-wise distributions are assumed to be static.

Proof of Theorem 5.4. With Assumption 5.3, we state Lemma D.8.

Lemma D.8 (fairness guarantee at a single step).

At each single step, the following results hold:

(i) Given 𝒟(t)superscript𝒟𝑡\mathcal{D}^{(t)}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT fixed (i.e., pa(t),pb(t)superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡p_{a}^{(t)},p_{b}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT stay fixed), increasing ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ in Eqn. (7) leads to lower or equal △fair,ℒt⁢(ρ)subscriptsuperscript△𝑡fairℒ𝜌\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ ) ;

(ii) Given the optimization objective fixed (i.e., ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ stays fixed), lower fraction disparity △p(t)superscriptsubscript△𝑝𝑡\triangle_{p}^{(t)}△ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT leads to lower or equal △fair,ℒt⁢(ρ)subscriptsuperscript△𝑡fairℒ𝜌\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ ) when the minority group incurs higher loss.

Proof of (i).

We prove (i) by contradiction.

Assume ρ1<ρ2subscript𝜌1subscript𝜌2\rho_{1}<\rho_{2}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and denote the the optimized model parameters as θρ1,θρ2subscript𝜃subscript𝜌1subscript𝜃subscript𝜌2\theta_{\rho_{1}},\theta_{\rho_{2}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since 𝒟ssubscript𝒟𝑠\mathcal{D}_{s}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT does not change over time, we can know the group-wise loss under ρ1,ρ2subscript𝜌1subscript𝜌2\rho_{1},\rho_{2}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at both rounds Ls,ρ1t=Ls,ρ1t−1=Ls,ρ1superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌1𝑡1subscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌1L_{s,\rho_{1}}^{t}=L_{s,\rho_{1}}^{t-1}=L_{s,\rho_{1}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Ls,ρ2t=Ls,ρ2t−1=Ls,ρ2superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌2𝑡1subscript𝐿𝑠subscript𝜌2L_{s,\rho_{2}}^{t}=L_{s,\rho_{2}}^{t-1}=L_{s,\rho_{2}}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, we can interchange the superscript arbitrarily (i.e., if the deployed models are the same, Lst=Lst−1superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠𝑡1L_{s}^{t}=L_{s}^{t-1}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT). Wlog, assume La,ρ1t>Lb,ρ1tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then consider all possible scenarios where the loss disparity may be larger:

  • •

    La,ρ1t<La,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}<L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb,ρ1t<Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}<L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: if this holds, then we can just shift θρ2subscript𝜃subscript𝜌2\theta_{\rho_{2}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to θρ1subscript𝜃subscript𝜌1\theta_{\rho_{1}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to guarantee smaller La,ρ2t,Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t},L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and therefore smaller La,ρ2t−1,Lb,ρ2t−1superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡1L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t-1},L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t-1}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, resulting in a smaller loss specified by Eqn. (7). This produces a contradiction since θρ2subscript𝜃subscript𝜌2\theta_{\rho_{2}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the minimizer;

  • •

    La,ρ1t>La,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb,ρ1t>Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: In the same way, we can shift θρ1subscript𝜃subscript𝜌1\theta_{\rho_{1}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to θρ2subscript𝜃subscript𝜌2\theta_{\rho_{2}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to trivially decrease both La,ρ1t,Lb,ρ1tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t},L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, violating the condition that θρ1subscript𝜃subscript𝜌1\theta_{\rho_{1}}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the minimizer;

  • •

    La,ρ1t<La,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}<L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb,ρ1t>Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. According to the optimality at ρ1,ρ2subscript𝜌1subscript𝜌2\rho_{1},\rho_{2}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have:

    pa⋅(La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t)+pb⋅(Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t)+pa⋅ρ2⋅((La,ρ2t)2−(La,ρ1t)2)+pb⋅ρ2⋅((Lb,ρ2t)2−(Lb,ρ1t)2)<0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑎subscript𝜌2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡2⋅subscript𝑝𝑏subscript𝜌2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡20p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L% _{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{a}\cdot\rho_{2}\cdot\left((L_{a% ,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\rho_{2}\cdot% \left((L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2}\right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -     pa⋅(La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t)+pb⋅(Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t)+pa⋅ρ1⋅((La,ρ2t)2−(La,ρ1t)2)+pb⋅ρ1⋅((Lb,ρ2t)2−(Lb,ρ1t)2)>0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑎subscript𝜌1superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡2⋅subscript𝑝𝑏subscript𝜌1superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡20p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L% _{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{a}\cdot\rho_{1}\cdot\left((L_{a% ,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\rho_{1}\cdot% \left((L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2}\right)>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (51)

    Subtract Eqn. (50) from Eqn. (51), we get

    pa⋅((La,ρ2t)2−(La,ρ1t)2)+pb⋅((Lb,ρ2t)2−(Lb,ρ1t)2)<0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡2⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡20\displaystyle p_{a}\cdot\left((L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2% }\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left((L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t})^{2}-(L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t})^{2}% \right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < 0 (52)
    ⇔⇔\displaystyle\Leftrightarrow~{}⇔ pa⋅(La,ρ2t+La,ρ1t)⋅(La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t)+pb⋅(Lb,ρ2t+Lb,ρ1t)⋅(Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t)<0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡0\displaystyle p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)% \cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L_{b,% \rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)\cdot\left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho% _{1}}^{t}\right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < 0

    From Eqn. (52) and Eqn. (51), we can immediately get:

    pa⋅(La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t)+pb⋅(Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t)>0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡0p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\left(L% _{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (53)

    Otherwise Eqn. (51) would be smaller than 00. We have by assumption La,ρ2t>La,ρ1t>Lb,ρ1t>Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}>L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then La,ρ1t+La,ρ2t>Lb,ρ1t+Lb,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}>L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Next, noticing that Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t<0superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡0L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}<0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < 0 and La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t>0superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡0L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}>0italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0, then if we divide La,ρ1t+La,ρ2tsuperscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}+L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT at both sides of Eqn. (52), then we will get:

    pa⋅(La,ρ2t−La,ρ1t)+pb⋅(Lb,ρ2t+Lb,ρ1t)(La,ρ2t+La,ρ1t)⋅(Lb,ρ2t−Lb,ρ1t)<0⋅subscript𝑝𝑎superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡⋅subscript𝑝𝑏superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎subscript𝜌1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌2𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏subscript𝜌1𝑡0p_{a}\cdot\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)+p_{b}\cdot\frac{% \left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)}{\left(L_{a,\rho_{2}}^{t}+L% _{a,\rho_{1}}^{t}\right)}\cdot\left(L_{b,\rho_{2}}^{t}-L_{b,\rho_{1}}^{t}% \right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ divide start_ARG ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b , italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < 0 (54)

    However, the LHS of Eqn. (54) is larger than the LHS of Eqn. (53), while the LHS requires the opposite, producing a contradiction. Finally, note that it is impossible to let loss of one group stays fixed while the other one changes where we can easily prove with similar contradictions.

Since all the above scenarios do not hold, we have proved (i). Moreover, if for any ρ2>ρ1subscript𝜌2subscript𝜌1\rho_{2}>\rho_{1}italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the loss disparities are equal, it means that both groups achieve minimal loss with a same θ∗superscript𝜃\theta^{*}italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is very uncommon considering the difference of demographic groups. Thus, increasing ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ commonly leads to lower loss disparity Δℒ(t)superscriptsubscriptΔℒ𝑡\Delta_{\mathcal{L}}^{(t)}roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. ∎

proof of (ii).

Next, we prove (ii) similarly. Denote the optimized group-wise loss under the two group fractions as Ls(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑠𝑡L_{s}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Ls′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑠′𝑡L_{s^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Wlog, assume La(t)>Lb(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡L_{a}^{(t)}>L_{b}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. We will have the following equations:

pa′(t)⋅(La′(t)−La(t))+pb′(t)⋅(Lb′(t)−Lb(t))<0⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑏′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡0p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}\cdot\left(L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{a}^{(t)}\right)+p_{b^{% \prime}}^{(t)}\cdot\left(L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{b}^{(t)}\right)<0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < 0 (55)
pa(t)⋅(La′(t)−La(t))+pb(t)⋅(Lb′(t)−Lb(t))>0⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡0p_{a}^{(t)}\cdot\left(L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{a}^{(t)}\right)+p_{b}^{(t)}\cdot% \left(L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{b}^{(t)}\right)>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (56)

To prove by contradiction, we need to consider the situations where the group fraction discrepancy becomes smaller. This can be either pa(t)<pb(t),pa′(t)>pa(t)formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡p_{a}^{(t)}<p_{b}^{(t)},p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}>p_{a}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT or pa(t)>pb(t),pa′(t)<pa(t)formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡p_{a}^{(t)}>p_{b}^{(t)},p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}<p_{a}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then consider all possible scenarios where the loss disparity may be larger:

  • •

    La(t)<La′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡L_{a}^{(t)}<L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb(t)<Lb′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡L_{b}^{(t)}<L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: Eqn. (55) does not hold;

  • •

    La(t)>La′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡L_{a}^{(t)}>L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb(t)>Lb′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡L_{b}^{(t)}>L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: Eqn. (56) does not hold;

  • •

    La(t)<La′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡L_{a}^{(t)}<L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Lb(t)>Lb′(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡L_{b}^{(t)}>L_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: Subtract Eqn. (55) from Eqn. (56), we can get:

    (pa(t)−pa′(t))⋅(La′(t)−La(t))+(pb(t)−pb′(t))⋅(Lb′(t)−Lb(t))>0⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡⋅superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑏′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿superscript𝑏′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡0\left(p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)\cdot\left(L_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L% _{a}^{(t)}\right)+\left(p_{b}^{(t)}-p_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)\cdot\left(L_{b% ^{\prime}}^{(t)}-L_{b}^{(t)}\right)>0( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⋅ ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 (57)

    Noticing that pa(t)−pa′(t)=−(pb(t)−pb′(t))superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑏′𝑡p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}=-\left(p_{b}^{(t)}-p_{b^{\prime}}^{(t)}\right)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = - ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), then only when pa(t)−pa′(t)>0superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝superscript𝑎′𝑡0p_{a}^{(t)}-p_{a^{\prime}}^{(t)}>0italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 we can make the above inequality holds. According to the situations where the group fraction discrepancy becomes smaller, we know pa(t)>pb(t)superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑏𝑡p_{a}^{(t)}>p_{b}^{(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT must hold and a𝑎aitalic_a is the majority group. However, this contradicts the initial condition La(t)>Lb(t)superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑎𝑡superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑏𝑡L_{a}^{(t)}>L_{b}^{(t)}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e, the majority group should not have higher group-wise loss.

Finally, it is easy to see the cases where losses stay fixed cannot satisfy Eqn. (55) and Eqn. (56) simultaneously. Thus, we prove (ii). ∎

With Lemma D.8, we can easily prove Thm. 5.4. What we need to prove is △fair,ℒPS⁢(ρ1)≥△fair,ℒPS⁢(ρ2)subscriptsuperscript△PSfairℒsubscript𝜌1subscriptsuperscript△PSfairℒsubscript𝜌2\triangle^{\text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho_{1})\geq\triangle^{% \text{PS}}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho_{2})△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ △ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Now we know at t𝑡titalic_t, higher ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ results in lower or equal △fair,ℒt⁢(ρ)subscriptsuperscript△𝑡fairℒ𝜌\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ ) ((i) of Lemma D.8). Then the lower or equal △fair,ℒt⁢(ρ)subscriptsuperscript△𝑡fairℒ𝜌\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ ) results in lower group fraction disparity at t+1𝑡1t+1italic_t + 1 (Assumption 5.3), and further causes lower loss disparity at t+1𝑡1t+1italic_t + 1 ((ii) of Lemma D.8). This enables a forward induction to prove that △fair,ℒt⁢(ρ)subscriptsuperscript△𝑡fairℒ𝜌\triangle^{t}_{\textsf{fair},\mathcal{L}}(\rho)△ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair , caligraphic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ρ ) is non-decreasing with ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ at each time step to infinity, which completes the whole proof of Thm. 5.4.

D.5 Discussion on Performative Optimal (PO) Solutions

The PO solution is defined as

𝜽PO:=𝔼Z∼𝒟𝜽⁢ℓ⁢(𝜽;Z),assignsuperscript𝜽POsubscript𝔼similar-to𝑍subscript𝒟𝜽ℓ𝜽𝑍\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}:=\mathbb{E}_{Z\sim\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{% \theta}}}\ell(\boldsymbol{\theta};Z),bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ ( bold_italic_θ ; italic_Z ) , (58)

𝒟𝜽subscript𝒟𝜽\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the fixed point distribution.

At a high level, the PO solution and the approximation between PS and PO solution largely follows the analysis in [4, 5], where Theorem 6 in [5] states that if conditions in Lemma 2.4 and ℓ⁢(⋅;⋅)ℓ⋅⋅\ell(\cdot;\cdot)roman_ℓ ( ⋅ ; ⋅ ) is Lzsubscript𝐿𝑧L_{z}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-Lipschitz in the second argument, then the PS and Po solution satisfies

‖𝜽PO−𝜽PS‖2≤2⁢Lz⁢ϵγ⁢(1−ϵ).subscriptnormsuperscript𝜽POsuperscript𝜽PS22subscript𝐿𝑧italic-ϵ𝛾1italic-ϵ\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PS}}\|_{2}\leq% \frac{2L_{z}\epsilon}{\gamma(1-\epsilon)}.∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ ( 1 - italic_ϵ ) end_ARG .

We note that the corresponding proof and the bound both only depend on the strong convexity coefficient γ𝛾\gammaitalic_γ and sensitivity coefficient ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ, where the fair objective and the original objective have the same values, but the fair objective did change the Lipschitz coefficient to L~z:=(1+ρ⁢ℓ¯2)⁢Lzassignsubscript~𝐿𝑧1𝜌superscript¯ℓ2subscript𝐿𝑧\tilde{L}_{z}:=(1+\rho\overline{\ell}^{2})L_{z}over~ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := ( 1 + italic_ρ over¯ start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and L~z:=(1+ρ⁢ℓ¯)⁢Lzassignsubscript~𝐿𝑧1𝜌¯ℓsubscript𝐿𝑧\tilde{L}_{z}:=(1+\rho\overline{\ell})L_{z}over~ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := ( 1 + italic_ρ over¯ start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG ) italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT when using fair penalty and fair reweighting mechanisms, respectively. Therefore, as long as we replace Lzsubscript𝐿𝑧L_{z}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with the corresponding new value L~zsubscript~𝐿𝑧\tilde{L}_{z}over~ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can use the same proof steps to show that

‖𝜽fairPO−𝜽fairPS‖2≤2⁢L~z⁢ϵγ⁢(1−ϵ),subscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript𝜽POfairsubscriptsuperscript𝜽PSfair22subscript~𝐿𝑧italic-ϵ𝛾1italic-ϵ\|\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}_{\textsf{fair}}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{% PS}}_{\textsf{fair}}\|_{2}\leq\frac{2\tilde{L}_{z}\epsilon}{\gamma(1-\epsilon)},∥ bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PS end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 2 over~ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ ( 1 - italic_ϵ ) end_ARG ,

where

𝜽fairPO:=arg⁡min𝜽⁡ℒfair⁢(𝜽;𝒟𝜽)assignsubscriptsuperscript𝜽POfairsubscript𝜽subscriptℒfair𝜽subscript𝒟𝜽\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\text{PO}}_{\textsf{fair}}:=\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{\theta}% }\mathcal{L}_{\textsf{fair}}(\boldsymbol{\theta};\mathcal{D}_{\boldsymbol{% \theta}})bold_italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT PO end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT fair end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_θ ; caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

But as we show previously, the fairness metrics are only stable and meaningful in PP when measured at the PS and Fair-PS solutions, so there isn’t much practical value in finding the FPO solution.
